messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Java and the RESTEasy/JAX-RS on Netty (resteasy-netty4) for a Java-based REST API framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `src/main/java/com/datastax/mgmtapi/resources/v1/NodeOpsResources.java`, I found that `NodeOpsResources.rebuild` is implemented to process HTTP requests to the path `/api/v1/ops/node/rebuild`. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
- Full HTTP request path: /api/v1/ops/node/rebuild
  - This is composed of the class-level path /api/v1/ops/node plus the method-level path /rebuild. There are no path parameters in curly braces for this endpoint.

- All HTTP methods acceptable: false
  - The endpoint defines only one HTTP method (POST) with @POST and @Path("/rebuild"). There is no general catch-all allowing every method.

- HEAD: false
  - There is no @HEAD method defined for this endpoint, and the code does not imply an implicit HEAD mapping.

- POST: true
  - The rebuild endpoint is implemented with @POST, handling POST requests.

- OPTIONS: false
  - There is no @OPTIONS method defined for this endpoint, and the code does not indicate automatic OPTIONS handling beyond what the container typically provides.

- TRACE: false
  - There is no @TRACE method defined.

- GET: false
  - There is no @GET method for /api/v1/ops/node/rebuild; the only defined method is POST.

- PUT: false
  - Not defined for this endpoint.

- DELETE: false
  - Not defined for this endpoint.

- PATCH: false
  - Not defined for this endpoint.

Explanation:
- The class has @Path("/api/v1/ops/node"), and the rebuild method has @Path("/rebuild") with @POST. Therefore, the full path is /api/v1/ops/node/rebuild and the HTTP method is POST.
- There are no other methods (HEAD/GET/PUT/DELETE/PATCH/OPTIONS/TRACE) defined for this specific endpoint in the provided code, so only POST is supported according to the code, and all other methods are not acceptable for this endpoint. The OPTIONS method is not implemented, and while containers often provide default handling for OPTIONS, the code-based conclusion here is that it is not explicitly supported.
